ratings.comment: He may have a lot of experience with powertrains but no much skill in relaying concepts. Tests and homework are tough and go way beyond what is discussed in lecture: forced to learn most concepts via youtube. Class on a curve but averages are normally below 50% on tests. Overall a very discouraging and unclear professorlecturer. Avoid if possible.

Professor John Moskwa seems like an intelligent, thought provoking, and kind individual.  Then when I enrolled in one of his courses, I began to realize he didn't have the slightest idea about the material he was covering.  I'm not sure whether he under-studied or was unprepared, but his effort towards sharing knowledge was nearly non-existent.

Hardest professor I have ever had in my 5 years in college.  The homework are near to impossible without over three hours a night on it, and the exams are not much better.  His grading does not help people who are not good test takers.  He grades the homework and exams so that barley anyone gets over 50% on anything.  IMPOSSIBLE CLASS.

Brilliant? Yes. Nice? Yes. Good teacher? Good God no. Moskwa really cares and wants students to do well, but makes it extremely hard to do so because of his awful teaching style and inability to proc student interest and relay concepts. He is a research man not a teaching man. Avoid his classes if possible.
He was a super nice guy once you get to know him. Utterly brilliant. But could be the worst teacher I have ever had. Couldn't relate to confused students. I would avoid if possible.

He's extremely helpful if you go talk to him in office hours - he basically gives you the answers for the 3 "Special Assignments" (each worth 10% of total grade). He will literally draw out how to set up your free body diagrams for you & write down which equations to use to complete the assignment. His dynamic systems class is not that hard at all.

He is the worst professor in Mechanical Engineering hands down.  He never actually teaches anything and expects you to understand things he never tells you.  I think I'm with everyone in my class - avoid at all costs.
Smart guy, but a horrible professor.  Cares more about his research than his students unfortunately.  I took him for control theory and highly regretted it.
Smart guy, according to his resume... Overall terrible teacher. Learned more from wikipedia than his lectures on control theory.

Horrible professor.  Lectures are pointless and the book does little to help you out.  Doesn't help you during office hours and says that you should know the material already, even though he won't teach it to you and the book doesnt have it.  Aviod him.  I am getting A's or AB's in every other class, but struggling to pass this one.

I went into depression before every lecture. This guy is bad. Avoid at all costs. I learned more in one day by a sub than I did the entire semester. Smart guy, but never uses examples or actually teaches anything of use.
He is horrible, take ME 340 with a different professor.  He often loves to fly to washington, DC. before exams and doesn't little to prepare you.

Moskwa has a bad rap on this site, but I found him fair, rigorous and encouraging. He takes an analytical approach to vehicle dynamics; the reason he derives things in class is so that you understand formulas rather than applying them blindly. Tests were difficult but I learned the material quite well. Moskwa is semi-tough but wants to help.
The notes from lecture are not very helpful. He is not the best at explaining the material. The exams are difficult and not related to material. The book is worthless. Think twice before taking him.

It was clear the man knew what he was doing. Beyond that, he couldn't teach himself out of a house of cards in a tornado. Office hours lead to more questions than answers. Exams were nothing like material covered in lecture and neither was the homework. STAY AWAY.

Only man that can take a subject like powertrain and make it boring. Going to his office hours with a question generally yields a "I think you're on the right track" rather than answers and lecture seldome hits very close to what he's looking for on the homework
hes smart and clear in theory, but the course is real tough, and he doesnt do examples.
extremely low exam averages, poor/no examples in class, lots of derivations during lecture
